verbs.description: depersonalize (third-person singular simple present depersonalizes, present participle depersonalizing, simple past and past participle depersonalized)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To remove a sense of personal identity or individual character from something; to anonymize.
(transitive) To present (something) as an impersonal object.
(psychiatry, intransitive) To suffer an episode of depersonalization.
examples: He's depersonalizing right now, so he's considering checking himself into the hospital.
